ch.epfl.biop.qupath.utils

Class GUIUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • qupath.lib.scripting.QP
      • qupath.lib.scripting.QPEx
        • ch.epfl.biop.qupath.utils.GUIUtils

  • public class GUIUtils
extends qupath.lib.scripting.QPEx
    Here we store a bunch of utility functions that are relevant to QuPath's User interface Like setting colors, lookup tables and such

    • Method Detail

      • getImagePlus

        public static ij.ImagePlus getImagePlus(qupath.lib.objects.PathObject pathObject,
                                        int downsample,
                                        boolean sendPathObjectAsRoi,
                                        boolean sendChildObjectsInOverlay)
        Returns an ImagePlus object with or without a ROI and with or without an overlay (if there are child objects) Careful as this will send the CURRENT viewer in batch mode. It will work but be careful if you have different image with different channels or something like that
        Parameters:
        pathObject - the annotation or detection you want to use as bounds for the image
        downsample - the downsample factor
        sendPathObjectAsRoi - should the pathObject ROI be added to the ImagePlus
        sendChildObjectsInOverlay - should the child objects be put in the Overlay of the ImagePlus
        Returns:
        image the ImagePlus with the ROI or Overlay as selected

      • getImagePlus

        public static ij.ImagePlus getImagePlus(qupath.lib.objects.PathObject pathObject,

      • getChannelMinMax

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getChannelMinMax(int channel)
        Returns a list with the minimum and maximum display values for the given channel
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel number, 1 based
        Returns:
        minmax a list with the channel's min and max value Example: 
          
  import ch.epfl.biop.qupath.utils.*;

  List<Integer> minmax = GUIUtils.getChannelMinMax(1);

      • getChannelMinMax

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getChannelMinMax(java.lang.String channel)
        Returns a list with teh minimum and maximum display values for the given channel
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel name, as a String
        Returns:
        minmax a list with the channel's min and max value

        Parameters:

      • setChannelMinMax

        public static void setChannelMinMax(java.lang.String channelName,
                                    double min,
                                    double max)
        Sets the minimum and maximum display range for a channel, defined by its name
        Parameters:
        channelName - the name of the channel, as seen in the Brightness Contrast Tool
        min - minimum channel display value
        max - maximum channel display value

                                    int min,
                                    int max)
        Sets the minimum and maximum display range for a channel, defined by its index (1 based)
        Parameters:
        channelID - channel index, 1 based
        min - minimum channel display value
        max - maximum channel display value
